org.mundo.rt
Class ServerStub

java.lang.Object
  org.mundo.rt.ServerStub
Direct Known Subclasses:
SrvDebugService, SrvIConfigure, SrvIME, SrvIMobility, SrvIProcess, SrvIProcessMonitor, SrvIProcessSignal, SrvIServiceManager, SrvIUS
public abstract class ServerStub
extends java.lang.Object

ServerStub is the abstract base class from which all server-side stubs are derived. Server-side stub classes for specific (user) classes are usually generated by using idlc. The compiler uses the prefix 'Srv' for server stubs.

Author:
Erwin Aitenbichler

Method Detail

invoke

public abstract void invoke(java.lang.Object o,
                            TypedMap m,
                            TypedMap r)
Invokes a method on the specified object.

Parameters:
o - the target object.
m - a map containing information about the originator, call mode, parameter types, and parameter values.
r - a map containing the response.

forName

public static ServerStub forName(java.lang.String className,
                                 java.lang.ClassLoader classLoader)
                          throws java.lang.ClassNotFoundException,
                                 java.lang.InstantiationException,
                                 java.lang.IllegalAccessException
Returns a ServerStub for the specified class name. For example, if the parameter is org.mundo.net.DebugService$LogEntry, the singleton instance of org.mundo.net.SrvDebugService$SrvLogEntry is returned.

Parameters:
className - the fully qualified class or interface name.
classLoader - the ClassLoader to use. Can be set to null.
Returns:
the server stub suitable for the specified class name.
Throws:
java.lang.ClassNotFoundException - if the class cannot be located.
java.lang.InstantiationException - if the server stub class is invalid, has no nullary constructor; or if the instantiation fails for some other reason.
java.lang.IllegalAccessException - if the server stub class or its nullary constructor is not accessible.

exceptionOccured

protected void exceptionOccured(java.lang.Exception x,
                                java.lang.Object o,
                                TypedMap m,
                                TypedMap r)
Called by a server stub implementation when an exception has been caught. exceptionOccured sends a reply message containing the exception to the client for non-oneway calls. For oneway calls, the stack trace is printed to System.out.

Parameters:
x - the exception thrown by the target object's implementation.
o - the target object.
m - a map containing information about the originator, call mode, parameter types, and parameter values.
r - a map containing the response.
